intro: Tournefortiopsis poasana, commonly known as the Poasana tournefortiopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
